questions.question: A pregnant woman is diagnosed with partial placenta previa. In explaining the diagnosis, the nurse tells the woman that the usual management for partial placenta previa is:

Upon assessment, the nurse got the following findings: two perineal pads highly saturated with blood within 2 hours postpartum, pulse rate = 80 bpm, fundus soft, and boundaries not well defined. The appropriate nursing diagnosis is:
options: Inadequate tissue perfusion related to hemorrhage

questions.question: What is the cause of pernicious anemia?

Nurse is preparing to assess the uterine fundus of a woman during the immediate postpartum period. When the nurse palpates the fundus, she feels the uterus is soft and boggy. Which of the following nursing interventions should be appropriate initially?
options: Massage the fundus until it is firm
Push on the uterus to assist in expressing clots

questions.question: Which of the following is a risk factor for developing gestational diabetes mellitus?
Which of the following cause of microcytic anemia?
The umbilical cord stump frequently sloughs off approximately at:
Aya, 28-year-old primigravida with 33 weeks of pregnancy suddenly complains of headache and blurred vision. Her blood pressure is 180/110 and urine albumin is +3. The line of further management is:
When the uterus is firm and contracted after delivery but there is bright fresh vaginal bleeding, the nurse should suspect which of the following:
options: Laceration of soft tissues of the cervix and vagina

questions.question: The most appropriate nursing recommendation for the pregnant woman who takes iron supplement to enhance the absorption is which of the following?
options: Take iron supplements with orange juice
Take iron supplements within the meal to enhance absorption
Take iron supplements with food help reduce constipation

questions.question: What is the most common cause of heart failure during pregnancy?

options: Excessive analgesia was given to the woman
Placental delivery occurred within thirty minutes after the baby was born
An episiotomy had to be done to facilitate delivery of the head
The labor and delivery lasted for 12 hours

questions.question: Pregnant woman is considered severe anemic when the hemoglobin is:
The nurse is assessing women’s lochia on a 1-day postpartum period. The nurse notes that the lochia is red and has a foul-smelling odor. The nurse determines that the assessment finding is:
options: Indicates the need for increasing oral fluids
Indicates the need for increasing ambulation

questions.question: Which of the following is described as a separation of a normally implanted placenta during the second half of pregnancy?
A pregnant woman is receiving iron supplementation and reports about her stool is dark black. The nurse should:
options: Hold the next dose of iron
Reassure the patient this is a normal side effect of iron supplementation

questions.question: Which of the following complication is most likely responsible for a secondary postpartum hemorrhage?
Which of the following refers to severe preeclampsia?
options: Proteinuria greater than 0.3 gram in 24-hour period
Proteinuria greater than 1 gram in 24-hour period
Proteinuria greater than 5 gram in 24-hour period
Proteinuria greater than 7.5 gram in 24-hour period

questions.question: The nurse can assist the cardiac pregnant woman to a comfortable position as:

options: Decrease sexual pleasure to male and female

options: The woman complains of a headache and blurred vision
Blood pressure reading is at the prenatal baseline

questions.question: Which of the following is a cardiac danger sign of pregnant woman?
Which of the following refers to term of tied-off the fallopian tubes:
The nurse is reviewing the laboratory test results of a pregnant woman. Which one of the following findings would alert the nurse to the development of HELLP syndrome?
Male procedure for sterility, seen as a permanent form of birth control.
Which of the following describes placenta previa marginalis?
options: Cervical opening is completely covered by the placenta
Cervical opening is partially covered by the placenta
The edge of placenta reaches internal os but not cover it

questions.question: Maha is pregnant in third trimester arrives at the obstetrics emergency room with painless vaginal bleeding. Which of the following conditions is suspected?
What is the standard test for diagnosis of diabetes mellitus?
Which of the following instructions are necessary for a pregnant woman who is to undergo a glucose challenge test (GCT)?
options: Consume a low fat diet for 48 hours prior to testing
Fast for 12 hours prior to testing
There are no dietary restrictions prior to testing
Consume a consistent carbohydrate diet (60 g) prior to testing

questions.question: Which of the following instructions would be the priority, when developing a plan of care for a woman newly diagnosed with gestational diabetes?
What medication is used as seizure prophylaxis during labor and postpartum?
In pregnancy with heart disease, the risk of cardiac complications increase at?
Risk factors of diabetes mellitus include all of the following EXCEPT?
options: Mother over 45 years of age and less than 20years

questions.question: The greater danger in breech presentation?
From physiological method of family planning all the following EXCEPT?
Which of the following fever, foul lochial discharge and subinvolution of the uterus are signs of?
The mode of action of IUCD all the following EXCEPT?
options: Act as mechanical barriers preventing ovum implantation in the endometrium
It can initiate sterile inflammatory reaction

When caring for a client with preeclampsia, which action is a priority?
options: Monitoring the client’s labor carefully and preparing for a fast delivery
Continually assessing the fetal tracing for signs of fetal distress
Checking vital signs every 15 minutes to watch for increasing blood pressure

questions.question: The safest position for a woman who is in labour with cord prolapse:
The pathological retraction ring of Bandle is associated with:
Six hours after delivery, the nurse notes that a woman’s fundus is two finger breadths above the umbilicus and deviated to the right of the midline. What is the most likely cause of this finding?
In threatened abortion, the size of uterus

A 32 year old gravida 3 para 0 at 13 weeks gestation presents to the emergency room with profuse vaginal bleeding after coitus. She also has mild abdominal cramps. Examination shows soft abdomen and the cervical os to be more than 2 cm in diameter and the presence of clots and tissues in the vaginal vault. U/S shows products of conception still present in the uterus. The most probable diagnosis in this case is:
Conservative treatment of placenta previa indicated in all of them except:
options: Delayed termination of pregnancy till (37-38th w)
Indicated in presentations after the 37th week
If baby is alive, small amount of bleeding

questions.question: A 35-year-old gravida 3, para 2 woman who is 38 weeks pregnant presents to the ED with painless, bright red vaginal bleeding. Which of the following is contraindicated?

HELLP of preeclampsia complication means:
options: Hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low WBCs
Hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low RBCs
Hypertension, elevated liver enzymes, low platelets
Hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low platelets

questions.question: How would the nurse check for clonus in a woman with preeclampsia?
options: Assess for beating of the foot when quickly dorsiflexed
Assess dorsiflexion by quickly plantar flexing

questions.question: Which of the following is the main cause of placenta abruption?

After doing Leopold’s maneuvers, the nurse determines that the fetus is in the ROP position. To best auscultate the fetal heart tones, the Doppler is placed:
options: Above the umbilicus at the midline
Above the umbilicus on the left side
Below the umbilicus on the right side
Below the umbilicus near the left groin

In which degree of uterine prolapse, the cervix protrudes from the vulva on straining?

options: It is used down in the vagina
No douche used for at least 6 hours after coitus
Used only one time and never repeated

options: Feeding the neonate max 5 minutes per side
Wearing a supportive brassiere with nipple shields
Breast-feeding the neonate at frequent intervals
